intro: Crassula centauroides, commonly known as the "Cape Hare’s foot," is a succulent plant native to South Africa. It features a compact, bushy growth habit with fleshy, blue-green leaves arranged in a rosette pattern. The plant produces small, star-shaped flowers in shades of pink or white during the spring and summer months. It is well adapted to arid environments, storing water in its thick, fleshy leaves. Crassula centauroides is a popular choice for rock gardens and xeriscaping due to its low maintenance and ornamental appeal.
